oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Tommy Overstreet and Penny DeHaven
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Tommy Overstreet (musician) and Penny DeHaven (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tommy Overstreet; Penny DeHaven; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Unidentified guitar tune [featuring Rick Phillips voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (00:47) Heaven is My Woman's Love (Tommy Overstreet) -- (03:21) Phillips introduces Overstreet to reflect on "Heaven is My Woman's Love" being a country song -- (07:04) Gwen (Congratulations) (Tommy Overstreet) -- (09:42) Forrest fire prevention tune ([Unidentified]) -- (10:41) I'll Never Break These Chains (Tommy Overstreet) -- (13:14) Phillips and Overstreet discuss Overstreet's obsession with performing in his youth, and Overstreet reflects on having to change his format -- (16:30) There's Got to be a Seed Before the Rose (Tommy Overstreet) -- (19:35) Phillips performs a nutritional commercial spot -- (21:13) Ann (Don't Go Runnin') (Tommy Overstreet) -- (23:23) Overstreet accredits his career to Richie Marino -- (27:16) (Jeannie Marie) You Were a Lady (Tommy Overstreet) -- (29:41) Armed Forced letter writing contest commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (30:15) Send Me No Roses (Tommy Overstreet) -- (32:50) Phillips introduces "I Believe in You" -- (33:22) I Believe in You (Tommy Overstreet) -- (35:43) Overstreet reflects on his new song: "If I Miss You Again Tonight" -- (36:27) If I Miss You Again Tonight [false start] (Tommy Overstreet) -- (36:35) If I Miss You Again Tonight (Tommy Overstreet) -- (39:13) Phillips and Overstreet say their goodbyes -- (39:29) Dishonorable Discharge commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (40:07) Play With Me (Penny DeHaven) -- (42:20) Phillips introduces DeHaven and both reflect on DeHaven's work entertaining the troops and "Play With Me" -- (43:15) Down in the Boondocks (Penny DeHaven) -- (45:40) Phillips introduces "I'll be Doggone" -- (45:52) I'll be Doggone (Penny DeHaven) -- (47:47) "I'll be Doggone" is discusses as a Marvin Gaye tune that DeHaven rerecorded, and Phillips inquires about DeHaven's hobbies -- (50:25) I'll Never Stop / I Gotta Stand Tall (Penny DeHaven) -- (52:24) Anti-smoking commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (53:27) Unidentified guitar tune [featuring Rick Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (54:47) Phillips inquires as to DeHaven's preference of show -- (55:44) The First Love (Unconfirmed) (Penny DeHaven) -- (58:34) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
